item.description:
UPDATE,
Rob indicated there is a concert in Hartford at the Adrien/Mortenson Landing at about 7 pm..
Some People are Hiking with Kevin in the morning..
This location is sort of on the return trip for some on the hike, and a way to meetup with the group before heading down to the concert..and as always..we might as well continue the evening with a bit of wine and sit around the fire..maybe dance also..
yeh i would have liked the ocean Great Iland trip but we wont make it back in time..so this is the best bang for the day as i see it..

Now parking in east hartford for the concert with Kayaks and walk over the bridge......there is a parking lot that seems pretty safe..but i personally dont like to keep a bunch of expensive yaks out in the open...i might ask if the Hotel would be safer for that..or just simply stop at my house and drop em off and drive the 3 miles to east hartford lot..and not worry...almost makes better sence to me...maybe even do the fire oit thing in my back yard.. thats to be discussed later though if enough interest exists...

There are some places to bike too if there isnt enough kayaks available...
some can stay behind too and relax by the water.....do some fishing ..etc..whatever..

Ok see Rob's Free Concert Listing, (he should list it soon) if for some reason the concert isnt on,,then we party right at the george site..
its still a few days away..the weather could be bad then too, dont know this far in adavnice..
Rain cancels the event obviously...
IF NECESSARY..i update..
Getting There:
This event is for everyone, kaykers will be going up stream this time..or some can go downstream also..ya can only go down stream so far anyway..you will find out whay...LOL

This Kayak Put in is easy to drive up to, and also seems secluded enough for a dinner/lunch and (wine event party) if we dont get to the concert..or if its not showing that night..

The location is called Curtis Park, a sucker ball, baseball fields and that kind of place, but on the river side there is a dirt road leading towards the river where there is a put in area..as you pass one of them ball fields..

This is flatwater so any yak will work just fine..




Getting There:
from hartford direction:
91 north to exit 36,
Take left (west direction) on to 178 (park ave) toward bloomfield for 1.6 miles.
At intersection take right onto 187 (north direction) (blue hills ave) for about 5 miles heading toward tariffville direction.
You will meet rte 187/189,
Stay on 189 to Tarriffville..at the end of the nice paved part you will end up in tariffville, take a left at the light onto rte 315 (elm st) follow it to the end at the stop sign take the left into Tarrifville road (the street sign says Withrop, thats the raod to the right though)..continue on 315 for about 1.2 miles, take a right into Curtis Park (right side) and go to the river via the dirt road..

ok if you use Mapquest, GPs or other..there is 2 Tariffville roads in the town and the numbers dont match right....
so just look at your map for Curtis Park..based the decriptors given above..
its near rte 315 and 202 intersection for a secondary land mark.

other info and map picture:
http://connecticut.qu....

Since i can..i might get there a bit earlier...
I put noon as a good time to head up stream..
